main event: A bright white light was sighted moving at a high speed over Tinker AFB in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma on September 20, 1950.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be at an altitude of approximately 100 feet and covered a distance of about 300 yards in 2-3 seconds.
The object was observed by multiple witnesses, including a Sergeant, Corporal, and Private First Class.
The object seemed to disappear from view about 2 miles northwest of the base.
There were no known aircraft in the local area at the time of the sighting.
The early warning radar station at the base was inoperative at the time of the observation.
witnesses: Sergeant, Corporal, and Private First Class
